definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: He closed a head gate so that the moat dried up and she could walk through.
sentences.chinese: 這樣一來，壕中的水乾了，姑娘就可以走到果園去了。

sentences.english: The battalion went directly to the airport to begin digging in.
sentences.chinese: 該營直接開到機場掘壕防守。

sentences.english: Afterward, Sun kidnaps Qin in the Gaojiazhuang village opposite earth trench.
sentences.chinese: 之後，孫某把秦某劫持到高家莊村對面一土壕裏。

sentences.english: The soldier looped a grenade into the enemy shelter trench.
sentences.chinese: 士兵將一枚手榴彈呈弧形拋進敵方掩蔽壕裏。

sentences.english: The troops received orders to trench the outpost .
sentences.chinese: 部隊接到命令在前哨周圍築壕加強防衛。

sentences.english: Has discovered a rarer Eastern Han Dynasty time trench around the cemetery.
sentences.chinese: 在墓地周圍發現了一條較爲罕見的東漢時期的隍壕。

definition: local tyrant/local strong man/(slang) nouveau riche
air drop/to drop supplies by air
pillbox (military fortification)/blockhouse/euphemistic way of writing 屌爆[diao3 bao4]
(neologism c. 2015) (slang) (used jokingly) to live on dirt (typically because one has spent all one's money on consumer items)
(video games) PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG)/battle royale game/last-man-standing game/to play PUBG (or similar game)/to win at PUBG (or similar game)
